page.title: 12Education in Featherstone
page.content: Education in the area is covered by three firstschools;tree middle schools and two high schools.The first schools;Regent Street,All Saints CofE aided and North Featherstone all cater for the 5-9 year olds and all have a nursery for the 3-5 year olds.The middle schools;George Street,North Featherstone and St Thomas'controlled cater for the 9-13 year olds and all wear the same navy, grey and white uniform.Featherstone High School caters for the 13-16 age group.Those wanting post-16 education go to Pontefract,Normanton or Wakefield.St Wilfrids is a catholic high school and has a wide sphere of influence and draws pupils in from over a six mile radius.It will admit children from other religions if there are places. St Wilfrids does have its own sixth form which by Autumn should number 200
